This city touched on the sea, so that the sea served on one side for a wall to it. Hence is that, in the place but now cited3 ‘⁶ Rabh Hezekiah read the Book of Esther in Tiberias, on the sourteenth day (of the month Adar), and also on the fifteenth day (see Esth. ix. 21), doubting whether it were compassed with walls from the days of J oshua‚ or not. But who would doubt this of Tiberias? when it is written, ⁴ And the fenced cities were Ziddim, Zer, Chammath, Rakkath, and Ohinnereth.' But it is clear to us that Rakkath is Tiberias. The reason, therefore, why he doubted was this, because on one side it was enclosed by the sea instead of a wall. But if it were so, why did he doubt? Because, truly, it was no wall.
